title: Russian River Pinot Noir Tasting
description:
Join us on Wednesday, April 16, from 4–7 PM at Whispering Vine South Creek for a focused tasting of Russian River Valley Pinot Noirs, showcasing the elegance, vibrancy, and complexity that define this world-renowned region.

Tasting Fee: $35 (Buy a bottle from the tasting and your fee is refunded)

Featured Wines:

  • Bricoleur Pinot Noir 2021 – 92 pts, Wine Enthusiast. Complex and bright with cherry, hibiscus, pomegranate, and subtle five-spice notes.
  • Belle Glos Dairyman Vineyard Pinot Noir 2021 – 94 pts, Tasting Panel. Luxurious and bold with spiced cranberry, black cherry, chocolate, and balsamic depth.
  • EnRoute Les Pommiers Pinot Noir 2022 – 93 pts, Wine Enthusiast. Delicate and expressive with dried rose, cherry, and berry pie, supported by lively acidity and fine tannins.
  • The Calling Russian River Pinot Noir 2022 – 90 pts, Wine Enthusiast. Floral and juicy with raspberry, cherry, orange blossom, and balanced acidity.

Come explore the beauty and diversity of Russian River Pinot Noir—buy a bottle and your tasting is free.
